TopicTitle: Was "Hack Gravity" removed from the debug menu?

Articles.Content:
I'm trying to lift a ridiculously large station up in one go, and I noticed that the hack gravity button seems to be missing.

http://i.imgur.com/Gq9ClUl.png

Was it just moved to somewhere else, or was it actually removed?

Edited October 4, 2014 by PTNLemay
Why would you want hack gravity in the VAB...

Well I want to set it so that it's on as soon as the ship is loaded it won't tip over. The entire space station is basically laid out there on the launch pad, and if I let it load for even a second it starts to tip over.

EDIT: Ah, you're right. On the actual launch pad hack gravity is still there. It'll take some quick action on my part, but I can work with this.

It stays hacked if you hack gravity, than go back to VAB, or go back to launch.

So even if it'd fall over, you hack gravity, and then go back to launch, and you'd also be fine
You can turn it on and revert, or if you have reverts turned off launch a pod, turn it on, and recover the pod.

Yeah, I got it to work.

Behold! The nonsensical monstrosity that is Station 02! http://i.imgur.com/ELaHKFH.png

EDIT: Oh... disaster has struck. Even without gravity the overly complicated construction of the station is wreaking havoc on the physics engine. I feel the station will wiggle itself to pieces before it reaches orbit...
